data.description: WAIT appears to be a scripted interjection or dramatic pause spoken by Abe rather than a distinct character. In context, 'WAIT' is formatted as dialogue capitalization within Abe's speech as he studies Dante and discovers the price tag on her suit jacket. It functions as a dramatic beat or exclamation within Abe's monologue rather than representing an independent character entity.
data.dialogue_summary: WAIT has a single dialogue instance consisting of the exclamation 'WAIT' followed by a stage direction indicating Abe is fondling a price tag on Dante's suit jacket. This is almost certainly a capitalized interjection within Abe's speech rather than a separate character speaking.

explicit_evidence.quote: WAIT... (fondling a tag left on HER SUIT JACKET) MMMMMM... yes --

inferred_traits.rationale: The word WAIT appears embedded within Abe's extended monologue as a dramatic pause before he reveals his deduction about Dante's suit tag, consistent with screenplay capitalization conventions for emphasis rather than a character name.
inferred_traits.value: Likely a formatting artifact or capitalized interjection within Abe's dialogue rather than a standalone character
